labels.analysis: The FrankfurterMCP server is designed to interact with the Frankfurter API, which provides currency exchange rate data. Its core functionality revolves around retrieving, converting, and analyzing historical and latest exchange rates for various currencies. The tools available focus on financial data access, specifically in the realm of forex (foreign exchange) information. The server doesn't just store data but actively performs currency conversions and historical analyses, making it a specialized tool for financial data processing and currency-related operations.
labels.reasoning: The primary label of "Financial Services" was chosen because the server's core functionality is directly related to financial data - specifically currency exchange rates. This aligns with financial services focused on currency exchange and financial data processing. Database Operations was selected as a secondary label because the server performs data queries (historical data lookups) and filter operations on currency data. The custom label of "Forex Data Analysis" was added because while some aspects fit under Financial Services, the specific focus on historical exchange rates and conversions makes this a specialized financial tool.

tools.name: get_supported_currencies
tools.description: Returns a list of three-letter currency codes for the supported currencies.

tools.name: get_latest_exchange_rates
tools.description:
Returns the latest exchange rates for specific currencies. The
symbols can be used to filter the results to specific currencies.
If symbols is not provided, all supported currencies will be returned.

base_currency.description: A base currency code for which rates are to be requested.
base_currency.title: Base Currency

symbols.description: A list of target currency codes for which rates against the base currency will be provided. Do not provide it to request all supported currencies.
symbols.title: Symbols

tools.name: convert_currency_latest
tools.description: Converts an amount from one currency to another using the latest exchange rates.

amount.description: The amount in the source currency to convert.
amount.title: Amount

tools.name: get_historical_exchange_rates
tools.description:
Returns historical exchange rates for a specific date or date range.
If the exchange rates for a specified date is not available, the rates available for
the closest date before the specified date will be provided.
Either a specific date, a start date, or a date range must be provided.
The symbols can be used to filter the results to specific currencies.
If symbols are not provided, all supported currencies will be returned.

base_currency.description: A base currency code for which rates are to be requested.
base_currency.title: Base Currency

symbols.description: A list of target currency codes for which rates against the base currency will be provided. Do not provide it to request all supported currencies.
symbols.title: Symbols

specific_date.description: The specific date for which the historical rates are requested in the YYYY-MM-DD format.
specific_date.title: Specific Date

start_date.description: The start date, of a date range, for which the historical rates are requested in the YYYY-MM-DD format.
start_date.title: Start Date

end_date.description: The end date, of a date range, for which the historical rates are requested in the YYYY-MM-DD format.
end_date.title: End Date

tools.name: convert_currency_specific_date
tools.description:
Convert an amount from one currency to another using the exchange rates for a specific date.
If there is no exchange rate available for the specific date, the rate for the closest available date before
the specified date will be used.

amount.description: The amount in the source currency to convert.
amount.title: Amount

specific_date.description: The specific date for which the conversion is requested in the YYYY-MM-DD format.
specific_date.title: Specific Date

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@anirbanbasu/frankfurtermcp/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
